author: Special Correspondent
text:
Confederation of Indian Industry (CII), Salem district, in association with the Indo-American Chamber of Commerce (IACC) will organise the first edition of Salem MSME Summit in the city on February 27. It will be held at Hotel Park Plaza.

The theme of the summit is “growth and prospects of MSME sector in the emerging scenario”.K. M. S. Rajesh Kumar, chairman, CII Salem, and P. Vimalan, vice chairman, told presspersons here on Thursday that the summit will provide an opportunity to share concepts, approaches and best practices that can be adapted or adopted by the industry/organisations.

The summit will create awareness about the need to understand and the policy matters and deploy technology to improve the quality of business and its assessment and the importance of technology, Mr. Rajesh Kumar added.

Technical

sessions

There will be two technical sessions which will cover; US business visa, Exim Policy and schemes, ERP solutions and cloud computing, organisation health check for MSMEs.

D. Sridhar, Joint Director General, Directorate General of Foreign Trade, and N.V. Srinivasan, Regional President South, Indo-American Chamber of Commerce, will address inaugural session at 10 a.m.

Other speakers for the various technical sessions include Walid Zafar, Vice Consul, American Consulate.

For registration, please contact CII, Salem: 0427 2448255 | 9943999630 or e-mail:cii.salem@cii.in
title: First edition of Salem MSME summit on February 27
